channel.title: Azure Automation Account on iAutomate
channel.description: Recent content in Azure Automation Account on iAutomate

item.title: Retrieve Azure Runbook Job Report using REST API with PowerShell
item.description: Introduction The tile may hit a question WHY? Because automation accounts and runbooks are almost outdated in 2021. Most prefer to use alternative solutions like Logic Apps, Function App Power Automate, or others. Hang On! Runbooks are still in use. Of late, I got a requirement to send a report on runbooks that got invoked in the last one hour. In PowerShell, itâ€™s easy, as shown below $Params = @{ RunbookName = 'MYRUNBOOKNAME' ResourceGroupName = 'MYRESOURCEGROUPNAME' AutomationAccountName = 'MYAUTOMATIONACCOUNTNAME' StartTime = $(Get-Date).
